body:
Comment 7: 
Apologies for the snarky summary text. I read all 496 open bugs today in order so this
is one of the last ones I processed. In my defense I don't think the new summary is that
much more snarky than the original "Spec is inconsistent and/or unhelpful about
iteration differences between string and []byte".

To answer your question...

I think it is okay to say that "Strings behave like slices of bytes but are immutable"
without also listing all the other ways in which they differ. Referring to the range
statement here seems odd since it hasn't been introduced yet, and the range section does
say explicitly:

1. For an array, pointer to array, or slice value a, ...
2. For a string value, ...

I am sure there are other ways in which string and []byte are different that we are both
forgetting. For example, you can have constant strings.

However, I am leaving this open for gri. I was just trying to shorten the summary and
put it in the usual form.
